00014         //class to handle animations (keeping track of all frames, when to go to next frame etc.)
00015         class __IMPORTEXPORT SpriteAnimation
00016         {
00017                 //TODO: Solve this so friend class isn't needed
00018                 friend class Sprite;    //give the sprite class full access to the animation
00019 
00020                 //frame structure - simple enough
00021                 typedef struct Frame
00022                 {
00023                         int x,y;
00024                         double delay;
00025                         int nextFrame;
00026                         Rect collisionBox;
00027                 };
00028 
00029         private:
00030                 int     currentFrame;   //current frame that is showing
00031                 double frameTimer;      //keeps track of when to go to the next frame
00032 
00033                 //C_COM_DynArray<Frame*> m_Frames;
00034                 std::vector<Frame*> frames;
00035                 string animationName;
00036 
00037         public:
00038                 SpriteAnimation();
00039                 ~SpriteAnimation();
00040 
00041                 void setName(const std::string animName) {animationName = animName;}
00042                 string getName(){return animationName;}
00043                 void addFrame(int x, int y, double delay, uint nextFrame, Rect colBox);
00044                 void runAnimation(double timeFactor);
00045                 void reset() { frameTimer = 0; currentFrame = 0; }
00046 
00047                 Frame * getCurrentFrame() { return frames[currentFrame]; }
00048 
00049                 //check if the animation is playing. if the next frame is the same as this one, it's not.
00050                 bool isPlaying()
00051                 {
00052                         return (frameTimer > 0);
00053                 }
00054         };
00055 
00056         //class to handle sprites
00057         class __IMPORTEXPORT Sprite
00058         {
00059         private:
00060                 //pointer to the texture that is used
00061                 Texture * texture;
00062 
00063                 //frame dimensions
00064                 int frameWidth;
00065                 int frameHeight;
00066 
00067                 //sprite position
00068                 float x;
00069                 float y;
00070 
00071                 //animation
00072                 double animationSpeed;
00073                 uint currentAnimation;
00074                 std::vector<SpriteAnimation *> animations;
00075 
00076 
00077 
00078         public:
00079                 Sprite();
00080                 ~Sprite();
00081 
00082                 bool create(Texture * texture, int frameWidth, int frameHeight);
00083 
00084                 void setPosition(float x, float y) { this->x = x; this->y = y; }
00085                 void render(float rotation = 0, bool border = false, bool hFlip = false, bool vFlip = false, float z=0, float maxSize = 0);
00086 
00087                 uint addAnimation(const char * name);
00088                 void addFrame(uint animID, int x, int y, double delay, uint nextFrame, Rect colBox);
00089                 const string getAnimationName(uint animID);
00090                 void updateAnimation(double timefactor);
00091                 void playAnimation(int anim, double speed = 1) { currentAnimation = anim; animationSpeed = speed; }
00092                 bool playAnimation(const char * anim, bool resetIfRunning = true, double speed = 1);
00093 
00094                 bool animationIsPlaying() { return (animations[currentAnimation]->isPlaying()); }
00095 
00096 
00097                 int getWidth() const { return frameWidth; }
00098                 int getHeight() const { return frameHeight; }
00099                 Rect getCollisionBox() const;
00100 
00101                 Sprite & operator=(Sprite);
